data.title: Living in Union City NJ Guide ☀️ | Tips & What to Know About Moving to Union City
data.meta_description: Wondering about living in Union City, NJ, but not sure if it will be right for you? ☀️ Read through our best guide on moving to Union City, and learn everything you need to know!
data.text:
Located in Hudson County and referred to as “Havana on the Hudson” due to the large amount of Cuban-Americans who live there, Union City boasts a rich history, a strategic location, and a reputation for its unique charm. From its humble beginnings as a diverse immigrant community to its modern-day prominence as a hub of cultural diversity, Union City offers a captivating blend of heritage and contemporary allure. If Union City sounds like the place you want to be, moving to Union City will be the best choice you’ll ever make!

Where is Union City, NJ?

Union City is a city located in Hudson County, Union City occupies a prime geographic position. Situated atop the picturesque Palisades, it offers breathtaking views of the New York City skyline and the Hudson River. Its proximity to major transportation routes and neighboring cities like Jersey City and Hoboken makes it an ideal destination for commuters and those seeking easy access to urban amenities. Union City's strategic location provides residents with a convenient blend of suburban tranquility and metropolitan opportunities, making it a desirable place to reside. The distance from Union City, NJ, to New York City, NY is 8.8 miles.

Union City, NJ Population & Demographics

Union City has a population of 65,639, with a population density of approximately 51,000 people per square mile, spread over an area of 1.3 miles. The town has a median age of 35.1, and 57.9% of its residents were born outside the United States, with 91% coming from Latin America. 27.7% of the population of Union City holds a bachelor's degree or higher certification.

Celebrities and notable people who live in Union City include the acclaimed actor Frank Sinatra, singer-songwriter Gloria Gaynor, and poet and novelist Junot Díaz.

Union City has a homogeneous population, with Hispanics comprising the majority at 83%, followed by Whites at 8%. The town's gender distribution is weighted towards men, at 51%.

Union City is a safe community to live in! Union City’s overall crime rate is 13% lower than the national average, with 2,040 crimes annually per 100,000 people. The property crime rate is 11% lower than the national average, while the violent crime rate is 23% lower. The community of Union City is served by the Union City Police Department, with over 200 sworn officers.

Cost of Living in Union City, NJ

Union City is a great place to live, but being right across the river from the Big Apple comes with some costs. The cost of living index for Union City is 28.7% higher than the national average. The median home price in Union City is $450,000, marginally higher than the average New Jersey home price of $389,800. If you want to make yourself a part of this community, you should check out the latest listings for Union City, NJ homes for sale. According to RentCafe, the average rent in Union City and nearby areas is around $1,673 per month for 643 square feet.

According to the Economic Policy Institute, a family of four will need a yearly income of $101,568 to live in Union City.

Union City, NJ Everyday Expenses

Want to know what sort of daily expenses you’ll be paying in Union City? Check out these everyday expenses for Union City, provided by Numbeo.

Gallon of milk - $4.35

Loaf of bread - $5.09

Gallon of gasoline - $3.79

Average Union City utilities per month - $365 (per Doxo)

Internet per month - $74.38

Where to Live in Union City, NJ

Want to know about the best neighborhoods in Union City? While this city is small, you’ll be surprised how many distinct neighborhoods and sub-communities are contained within!

West Hoboken

Located on the western side of Union City, West Hoboken is known for its residential charm, featuring tree-lined streets and a mix of architectural styles, including brownstones and row houses.

The Heights

Situated on the higher elevation of both Jersey City and Union City, The Heights neighborhood provides picturesque views of the surrounding area. It offers a mix of housing options and a tranquil suburban atmosphere.

Hudson Avenue

This neighborhood offers a close-knit community feel with a range of housing options, including single-family homes and apartment complexes. It provides easy access to transportation and local amenities.

Union City, NJ Climate & Weather

According to the Koppen Climate Classification, Union City is a humid subtropical climate. If you know New York and New Jersey, the weather here won’t hold many surprises. You can expect lows of 25 degrees Fahrenheit during the winter months and highs of 85 degrees Fahrenheit during the summer months. Union City gets more than the average amount of rainfall for the United States, with 48 inches per year. Union City experiences just around the average for snow, with 26 inches annually. The best times to visit Union City, in terms of comfort rating, are June and September.

Union City and its surroundings don’t experience extreme weather generally but can be subject to extreme winters as well as storms that result from southerly hurricanes.

Things to Do in Union City

For an exceptional shopping experience in Union City, NJ, don't miss the opportunity to visit the Columbia Park Center. Additionally, here are some top Union City attractions worth exploring.

Ellsworth Park

Featuring play equipment and walking areas, Ellsworth Park makes for a lovely place to spend a day outdoors in Union City.

301-399 24th St, Union City, NJ 07087, (201) 348-5600

Washington Park

With sports fields, play equipment, a dog park, and more, Washington Park is the one park that will fulfill all your needs in Union City.

Union City, NJ 07087, (201) 348-5747

Hamilton Park

Famous for being the site of the legendary Hamilton-Burr duel, this park also provides a peaceful spot right on the Hudson.

Boulevard East, Hudson Pl, Weehawken, NJ 07086, (201) 319-6061

Union City, NJ additional attractions

Washington Park Dog Run

Riverview-Fisk Park

Sybil's Cave

Union City is served by the Union City Parks & Recreation Department. See upcoming events and attractions on the Union City event calendar.

Places to Eat in Union City, NJ

Union City, New Jersey boasts a diverse selection of outstanding restaurants. Discover some of the top-rated dining destinations in the community below.

El Artesano

Union City is known for its Cuban population, and with their immigration, they brought their fantastic food, of which El Artesano provides authentic and delicious dishes!

4101 Bergenline Ave, Union City, NJ 07087, (201) 867-7341

Maria Mentiras Bar & Grill

Providing a more general kind of Latin fusion food, Maria Mentiras is perfect for a Union City resident looking for a more general palate of Latin cuisine.

328 32nd St, Union City, NJ 07087, (201) 348-0178

Casa di Napoli

Of course, what would a city right beside New York be without a good Italian restaurant? Casa di Napoli provides Union City residents with excellent and authentic Italian dishes.

PROFESSIONAL BUILDING, 703 32nd St, Union City, NJ 07087, (201) 867-1934

Jobs in Union City, NJ

Located right in the center of the New York metro area’s industry, finding Union City job opportunities has never been easier! The most popular positions in Union City are Software Engineer, Office Manager, and Director of Operations. The most popular employer in Union City is the Union City Board of Education. The average salary for a worker in Union City is $72k a year, while the average hourly wage is $18.56, according to Payscale.

See the latest openings for jobs in Union City.

Union City, NJ Schools

The Union City School District oversees the public school system in the city, providing quality education to its students with a strong focus on academic achievement and student success. Notable examples include Jefferson Elementary and Union City High. The district operates a comprehensive network of schools, including elementary, middle, and high schools, as well as specialized programs and magnet schools.

Students and others residing in Union City are served by the Union City Public Library.

Union City, NJ Statistics & Information

Located in Hudson County

Union City Area: 1.29 square miles

Union City Zip Codes: 07087

Union City Area Codes: 201

Union City Elevation: 190’

Union City Time Zone: Eastern Standard Time (EST)

Union City’s Closest airport: Newark Liberty International Airport (EWR), 12.5 miles from Union City

Map of Union City, NJ

Explore Union City’s large variety of things to do, places to eat, and more with this map!
